page.title: 19Coal-mining under Kinoulton
page.content: When the people of Kinoulton were told that the{National Coal Board} wanted to mine under Kinoulton,they were very concerned because of the possible subsidence and damage to the houses,and so they formed a committee {CRACK- Committee of Residents Against {Coal-mining}under{Kinoulton.}It was told that there was going to be a {PUBLIC INQUIRY}because the Coal Board needed permission from the County Council. At the inquiry Nottinghamshire County Council said that they would give permission on two conditions-{ {1.}There had to be minimal subsidence damage to houses. {2.}No mining under what was the site of the old brickworks as it was a {SITE of SPECIAL SCIENTIFIC INTEREST. The chairman of the inquiry has not yet made a decision.
